You can add ğŸ”¸|Left (can also use `lef: You can add ğŸ”¸|Left (can also use `left`, `LEFT` or `L` to replace the `Left` before), ğŸ”¸|Right (right/RIGHT/R) and ğŸ”¸|Inline (inline/INLINE/inl/INL/Inl) ğŸ”¸|Centre/Center (CENTRE/CENTER/centre/center/C) (the â€œcentreâ€ one is for the â€œObsidian Default Image Position above only, because Topaz's default image position is in the centre) into a image format to adjust the image position, e.g. ![[*.jpg|L]], ![[*.png|Right|200]] and ![|inl](...*.jpg)
You can add ğŸ”¸#Left|your captions (can: You can add ğŸ”¸#Left|your captions (can also use `left`, `LEFT` or `L` to replace the `Left`), ğŸ”¸#Right (or right/RIGHT/R)|your captions, ğŸ”¸#center/centre (CENTRE/CENTER/Center/Centre/C) |your captions and ğŸ”¸#inl (Inline/INLINE/inline/INL/Inl) |your captions into a image format to adjust the image position with a image caption, e.g. ![[*.jpg#left|Figure 1]], ![[*.png#right|Figure 2|200]], ![[*.jpg#centre|Figure 3]] and ![[*.jpg#inl|Figure 4|100]]
You can add ğŸ”¸|+grid into some images: You can add ğŸ”¸|+grid into some images to grid these images in a line, e.g. ![[*.jpg|+grid]] Or type â—cssclassï¼šimg-gridâ— in YAML to make images arrange in a grid in the preview mode. require Contextual Typography plugin

There are some built-in CSS classes that: There are some built-in CSS classes that should be manually declared in the YAML area. Details refer to the TIPS demo vault for Blue Topaz on Github.
â—cssclassï¼škanbanâ— A kind of kanban-l: â—cssclassï¼škanbanâ— A kind of kanban-liked style for unordered lists. (Adapted from Spectrum theme by @Wiktoria Mielcarek)
â—cssclassï¼šcode-wrapâ— Can be used to: â—cssclassï¼šcode-wrapâ— Can be used to wrap code in code blocks for individual .md file
List in a horizontal row (inline list): List in a horizontal row (inline list)
â—cssclassï¼šinline-listâ— To make the l: â—cssclassï¼šinline-listâ— To make the list show in a horizontal row. Meanwhile, it makes the list show inline which can be used with inline images (like ![[xxx.jpg|inlineR]])
â—cssclassï¼šimg-gridâ— To make images a: â—cssclassï¼šimg-gridâ— To make images arrange in a grid in the preview mode. (adapted from https://github.com/iEchoxu/obsidian_orange/blob/main/.obsidian/snippets/image-grid.css)
â—cssclassï¼šmatrixâ— Usage https://foru: â—cssclassï¼šmatrixâ— Usage https://forum.obsidian.md/t/theme-spectrum-version-1-0-0-and-resise-graphs-controls/12688/34 (Adapted from Spectrum theme by @Wiktoria Mielcarek)
â—cssclassï¼šfullwidth wide-dataview wi: â—cssclassï¼šfullwidth  wide-dataview wide-table wide-callout  wide-backlinksâ— (Adapted from https://github.com/efemkay @ Faiz Khuzaimah)
